result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry Jamar Brown

records.addlTxt: Case adjourned for same date as defendant's other case 19CF5064 scheduled for a motion hearing; both cases are tabbed to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
This case was set in Branch 16 20 10/17 at 1:30 by prelim court. This date does not work for the court so this case is being adjourned to 10/21 at 1:30. Parties notified.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Q. Arnold. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Jude in court for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for motion hearing. Defense filed motion to dismiss count 2 as multiplicitious. Motion hearing proceeded. Arguments placed on the record. For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED defense motion to dismiss count 2 due to multiplicity. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. STATES RESPONSE TO DEFENSE MOTION TO DISMISS COUNT 2 DUE TO MULTIPLICITY

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown not in court, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Michael Jude in court in person for Jerry Jamar Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel requests for the case to be adjourned to the trial court to address a Multiplicity Motion. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Motion Hearing.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. MOTION TO DISMISS COUNT 2 AS MULTIPLICITIOUS

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Jerry Jamar Brown not in court, in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.     
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense requests an adjournment due to multiplicity issues within the criminal complaint. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Jerry Jamar Brown not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties address issues within complaint. Case is adjourned for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Jerry Jamar Brown not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense to file a motion as to duplicate counts in this matter and 22CF2453. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Br. 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in court by video with Attorney Michael Jude who appears in person.  Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to court congestion and the lateness of the hour Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Attorney Jude is out ill. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Jerry Jamar Brown in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerry Jamar Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
